DOC.brief_summary: The objective was to assess adverse event risk in the use of Nitrous Oxide for Pediatric Dental Patients. The investigators performed a multicenter observational study. The investigators included patients aged 1 to 18 years and who have already failed dental care because of non-cooperation; they could be with mental or cognitive disabilities and could have sedative premedication. The investigators performed any type of dental care With the Use of Nitrous Oxide/Oxygen Sedation. The primary outcome was vomiting assessed during or after dental care.
DOC.brief_title: Adverse Event Risk Assessment in the Use of Nitrous Oxide for Pediatric Dental Patients
DOC.criteria: Patients under 18 years Use of nitrous oxide/oxygen analgesia/anxiolysis Any type of dental care Use of midazolam Use of general anesthesia
